To step outside the framework of the game means to betray its very spirit, destroying the fragile reality of common rules and unwritten laws for which we all gathered around this digital campfire, so that, hiding behind cynical pragmatism or childish whim, you break the fourth wall, devalue the work and efforts of others, turn a living adventure into a dead mechanism for achieving selfish goals, deprive the world of the magic of unpredictability and deprive others of the right to a fair choice, thereby killing the game as an art, as a dialogue, and as an escape from the gray reality that we all so wanted to forget for a while.
